translated: The Mansion Chapter🔽The Divine Maiden’s Mansion🔽The Cittalatā Mansion

analyzed: citta latā vagga  caṇḍāli vimāna vatthu
translated: The Divine Maiden’s Mansion of the Outcaste
“Outcaste, pay homage at the feet
of the famous Gotama.
Out of compassion for you,
the seventh sage is standing there.
Have faith in the one worthy of faith,
the one who is worthy.
Quickly pay homage with hands raised in reverence,
your life is short.”
Urged by the one who bears the body for the last time,
the outcaste paid homage at the feet
of the famous Gotama.
A cow killed the outcaste
standing with hands raised in reverence,
worshipping the Buddha,
the light-bringer in the darkness.
“The one with taints destroyed, dust-free, unshaken,
alone, seated in seclusion in the wilderness,
having attained the divine powers, I approached
and worshipped you, hero of great power.”
“Golden-colored, radiant, of great splendor,
having descended from the mansion of the gods, with many thoughts,
surrounded by a group of celestial nymphs,

original: Kā tvaṁ subhe devate vandase maman”ti.
analyzed: kā tvam subhe devate vandase mamanti
translated: beautiful goddess, whom do you worship?”
“I am an outcaste, reverend sir,
sent by you, the hero,
I worshipped the feet of the Worthy One,
of Gotama, the famous one.

analyzed: sā aham vanditvā pādāni  cutā caṇḍāla yoniyā
translated: Having worshipped his feet,
I was reborn in a happy place,
in a heavenly mansion, all around delightful.
A hundred thousand celestial nymphs,
stand in attendance on me;
I am the best and foremost of them,
in beauty, fame and youth.
I am endowed with many good qualities,
I am mindful and aware;🔽I have come to worship the Sage,
the compassionate one in the world.”
Having said this, the female outcaste,
grateful and thankful,
having worshipped the feet of the Worthy One,
disappeared right there.
The Fourth Female Outcaste’s Mansion.
